channel.description: Recent content in serve on Stats On the T

item.title: A Spatial Exploration of Serve Patterns
item.description: Using a recently discovered source of summary tracking data for Grand Slam matches, Peter Tea explores the spatial features of top men’s and women’s serves.

item.title: Sizing Up the Height Advantage on Serve
item.description: Can you ever have too much height in tennis? In this post, Peter Tea analyzes two sides of the “big server” equation as he delves into the influence of height on the rate of aces hit and aces allowed among ATP players.

item.title: Assessing the Fit of a Serve Prediction Model
item.description: A model that could predict a player’s performance on serve would have a number of interesting uses like forecasting the outcome of matches or identifying surprising performances. But for any of these uses the model would need to be accurate and reliable. How should we evaluate a model’s performance? And how do we know when a model is good enough?

item.title: Best Men's Surface Performances in 2017
item.description: Who dominated each surface in 2017? This post breaks down the best clay, hard, and grass performers on the men’s tour this year.

item.title: Best WTA Servers and Returners of 2017
item.description: 2017 has been a wide-open year for the WTA. What do Elo ratings tell us about the standout serve and return performances of the season?

item.title: Best ATP Servers and Returners of 2017
item.description: Who was the best server in 2017? Who was the best receiver? Which players were the most improved servers and receivers? This post reviews the standout performances of male players in 2017 using serve/return Elo ratings.

item.title: Is Fatigue Cumulative?
item.description: Fighting off fatigue in any Grand Slam match is a challenge. Does this get even harder after multiple matches?
